p:
The outbreak on Reunion Island was much larger in comparison, and took place in two episodes: (i) the first started in March 2005 and affected about 3000 people before it settled on a low, but persistent, infection rate from June onwards, (ii) the second episode took place between December 2005 and April 2006 and resulted in about 250,000 infections. In total, about 34% of the entire population of the island (about 780,000 people) was infected [ 4, 36]. On this basis, we partitioned the cases into two datasets: δ
S , which consists of the cases prior to 20 November 2005 [ 77], and δ
L , which consists of all cases from both episodes.
